roleset.name: injure, put stress on, violent exertion
roleset.note: STRAIN-V NOTES: Member of Vncls hurt-40.8.3-2. (from strain.01-v)
STRAINING-N NOTES: Based on temprel data. Comparison to strain.01. Strain.01 is a member of VN class hurt-40.8-3-2. Framed by Katie. (from straining.01-n)

example.name: physical hurt
example.text: The harder he tried to push them into large piles, the closer he-1 came to *trace*-1 breaking the rake and straining his back.

example.name: metaphysical hurt
example.text: [The fight]-1 is putting a tight squeeze on profits of many, *trace*-1 threatening to drive the smallest ones out of business and straining relations between the national fast-food chains and their franchisees.
example.arg: relations between the national fast-food chains and their franchisees

example.name: Defecation causes the straining, 'he' would be the experiencer
example.text: He developed difficulties with constipation and it was described as a significant amount of straining with defecation.

roleset.name: separate solids from liquid
roleset.note: STRAIN-V NOTES: Member of Vncls wipe_manner-10.4.1. (from strain.02-v)

example.name: solids and liquids still mixed
example.text: The idea behind the Egg King is pretty simple: *trace* put the eggs into a cylinder that contains perforated baskets, spin them at a high speed to break the shells and strain the edible part through the baskets.

example.name: separated args
example.text: John strained the chunks out of his glass of expired milk before drinking it.
example.arg: out of his glass of expired milk

example.name: work it, baby!
example.text: And, since the public has always been fascinated by gossip and voyeurism, reporters and editors will strain for creative angles to justify the inclusion of collateral facts about private lives including sexual activities and domestic relationships, activities of family members, and all matters about mental and physical health.
example.arg: since the public has always been fascinated by gossip and voyeurism
to justify the inclusion of collateral facts about private lives including sexual activities and domestic relationships, activities of family members, and all matters about mental and physical health

roleset.name: adjectival: hurting
roleset.note: STRAIN-V NOTES: This usage hurts me. It should really be combined with strain.01 (see "metaphysical" example). (from strain.04-v)

example.name: one arg
example.text: Judge Kozinski found [the derivation]-1 entirely strained *trace*-1 and writes that ``for an academic to refer to himself as an intellectual gigolo is ... a devastating admission of professional dishonesty.''

example.name: both args
example.text: Intel makes semiconductors and Campeau-1 operates department-store chains and is strained *trace*-1 for cash.
